alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Haskell; Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN HASKELL...NORTHERN JONES AND NORTHEASTERN FISHER COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 824 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms in northeastern Fisher County, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Stamford, Hamlin, Neinda, Mccaulley, Sagerton, Hitson, and Tuxedo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
